com.inqwell.any.beans

Interface Facade

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Any, Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ComponentFacade, DialogF, FrameF, ListF, SelectionF, TableF, TextF, UIFacade, WindowF
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractButtonGroup, AnyArrowButton, AnyBox, AnyButton, AnyButtonGroup, AnyCAction, AnyCard, AnyCButtonGroup, AnyCCheck, AnyCDockable, AnyCDropDown, AnyCheck, AnyCMenu, AnyComboBox, AnyComponent, AnyCPanelPopup, AnyCRadio, AnyDateChooser, AnyDesktopPane, AnyDialog, AnyDocView, AnyFileChooser, AnyFrame, AnyGrid, AnyInternalFrame, AnyLabel, AnyLabelFor, AnyLayoutContainer, AnyList, AnyMenu, AnyMenuBar, AnyMultipleCDockable, AnyPopupMenu, AnyProgressBar, AnyRadio, AnySelection, AnySimpleComponent, AnySingleCDockable, AnySlider, AnySortView, AnySpinner, AnySplit, AnyTabbedPane, AnyTable, AnyText, AnyToggleButton, AnyToolBar, AnyTree, AnyView, AnyWindow

    public interface Facade
extends Any
    Allow wrapping of external sub-system objects (also called components) into the Any client-side framework.

    The external sub-system is assumed to support hierarchies of objects in some generic way (i.e. Swing) although in the Any framework these hierarchies may be different to their native counterparts as well as differing in their function and requirements.

    Implementations must support a context, which is a node of significance in Any hierarchy. This node is typically the root of some application subdivision, such as a window, self-standing dialog or tab child.

    • Method Summary

      Return the path that represents the context for this component.
